content:
Based on the execution logs, I'll generate a report of the existing structures and error tips.

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Ore Processing Line at (-2.0, -76.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-2.0, -76.0) extracting iron ore
- Stone furnace at (-1.0, -74.0) smelting iron plates
- Burner inserter at (0.5, -74.5) moving items from furnace
- Iron chest at (1.5, -74.5) collecting iron plates
- Burner inserter at (2.5, -74.5) for output handling

### Copper Ore Processing Line at (-21.0, -73.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-21.0, -73.0) extracting copper ore
- Iron chest at (-21.5, -74.5) collecting copper ore
- Burner inserter at (-20.5, -74.5) moving items
- Stone furnace at (-19.0, -74.0) smelting copper plates

### Secondary Processing Line at (3.0, -73.0)
Consists of:
- Stone furnace at (3.0, -73.0)
- Stone furnace at (5.0, -73.0)
- Iron chest at (3.5, -71.5) connected to both furnaces
- Burner inserter at (1.5, -72.5) for input handling
- Iron chest at (0.5, -72.5) storing iron plates
- Burner inserter at (6.5, -72.5) for output handling
- Iron chest at (7.5, -72.5) collecting output

ERROR TIPS

### Fuel Management Issues
- Ensure mining drills have fuel before operation - the iron ore mining drill at (-2.0, -76.0) is out of fuel

### Furnace Operation Issues
- Multiple furnaces are showing "no ingredients to smelt" warnings. Ensure proper input material flow through inserters
- Some furnaces have full output storage preventing further operation - implement better output clearing mechanisms

### Entity Placement Optimization
- When creating processing lines, ensure all components (mining drills, furnaces, inserters, chests) are properly aligned and connected for optimal material flow
